name: py-networkx

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: extra
variants.description: Optional requirements that may require extra steps to install

description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-lxml
dependencies.description:
lxml is the most feature-rich and easy-to-use library for processing XML
and HTML in the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pydot
dependencies.description: Python interface to Graphviz's Dot language

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-sympy
dependencies.description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: py-python-louvain
dependent_to.description:
This module implements community detection. It uses the louvain method
described in Fast unfolding of communities in large networks, Vincent D
Blondel, Jean-Loup Guillaume, Renaud Lambiotte, Renaud Lefebvre, Journal
of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment 2008(10), P10008 (12pp)

dependent_to.name: py-colormath
dependent_to.description: Color math and conversion library.

dependent_to.name: falcon
dependent_to.description:
Falcon: a set of tools for fast aligning long reads for consensus and
assembly. The Falcon tool kit is a set of simple code collection which I
use for studying efficient assembly algorithm for haploid and diploid
genomes. It has some back-end code implemented in C for speed and some
simple front-end written in Python for convenience.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.

dependent_to.name: py-markov-clustering
dependent_to.description: Implementation of the Markov clustering (MCL) algorithm in python

dependent_to.name: py-pythran
dependent_to.description: Ahead of Time compiler for numeric kernels.

dependent_to.name: py-strawberryfields
dependent_to.description: Open source library for continuous-variable quantum computation

dependent_to.name: py-scine-chemoton
dependent_to.description: Software driving the automated exploration of chemical reaction networks

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-fuzzy
dependent_to.description: Fuzzy logic toolkit for SciPy

dependent_to.name: py-kosh
dependent_to.description:
Kosh allows codes to store, query, share data via an easy-to-use Python
API. Kosh lies on top of Sina and can use any database backend supported
by Sina. In adition Kosh aims to make data access and sharing as simple
as possible.

dependent_to.name: py-pennylane
dependent_to.description: PennyLane is a Python quantum machine learning library by Xanadu Inc.

dependent_to.name: possvm
dependent_to.description:
Possvm (Phylogenetic Ortholog Sorting with Species oVerlap and MCL) is a
python tool to analyse pre-computed gene trees and identify pairs and
clusters of orthologous genes. It takes advantage of the species overlap
algorithm implemented in the ETE toolkit to parse the phylogeny and
identify orthologous gene pairs, and MCL clustering for orthogroup
identification.

dependent_to.name: gaudi
dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependent_to.name: py-parsl
dependent_to.description: Simple data dependent workflows in Python

dependent_to.name: py-trimesh
dependent_to.description: Import, export, process, analyze and view triangular meshes

dependent_to.name: py-pycortex
dependent_to.description: Python Cortical mapping software for fMRI data.

dependent_to.name: py-gmxapi
dependent_to.description:
Python bindings and ensemble workflow management for GROMACS. The
GROMACS C++ API is affected by its package variants. You can specify a
particular GROMACS API by making the dependency variant explicit. E.g.
``spack install gmxapi ^gromacs+mpi~double``

dependent_to.name: py-torch
dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-vcf-kit
dependent_to.description:
VCF-kit is a command-line based collection of utilities for performing
analysis on Variant Call Format (VCF) files.

dependent_to.name: py-yahmm
dependent_to.description: YAHMM is a HMM package for Python, implemented in Cython for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-isa-rwval
dependent_to.description:
Metadata tracking tools help to manage an increasingly diverse set of
life science, environmental and biomedical experiments

dependent_to.name: py-instrain
dependent_to.description:
inStrain is python program for analysis of co-occurring genome
populations from metagenomes that allows highly accurate genome
comparisons, analysis of coverage, microdiversity, and linkage, and
sensitive SNP detection with gene localization and synonymous non-
synonymous identification.

dependent_to.name: py-pypeflow
dependent_to.description:
pypeFLOW is light weight and reusable make / flow data process library
written in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: py-panaroo
dependent_to.description: A Bacterial Pangenome Analysis Pipeline

dependent_to.name: py-hyperopt
dependent_to.description:
Hyperopt is a Python library for serial and parallel optimization over
awkward search spaces, which may include real-valued, discrete, and
conditional dimensions.

dependent_to.name: py-nipype
dependent_to.description: Neuroimaging in Python: Pipelines and Interfaces.

dependent_to.name: snakemake
dependent_to.description:
Workflow management system to create reproducible and scalable data
analyses.

dependent_to.name: py-whatshap
dependent_to.description:
WhatsHap is a software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing
reads, also called read-based phasing or haplotype assembly.

dependent_to.name: py-mikado
dependent_to.description:
Mikado is a lightweight Python3 pipeline whose purpose is to facilitate
the identification of expressed loci from RNA-Seq data * and to select
the best models in each locus.

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)

dependent_to.name: py-dgl
dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.

dependent_to.name: pagmo
dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.

dependent_to.name: py-prov
dependent_to.description:
A Python library for W3C Provenance Data Model (PROV). A library for W3C
Provenance Data Model supporting PROV-JSON, PROV-XML and PROV-O (RDF)

dependent_to.name: py-scanpy
dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.

dependent_to.name: py-mapclassify
dependent_to.description: Classification Schemes for Choropleth Maps.

dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen
dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependent_to.name: py-quantum-blackbird
dependent_to.description:
Blackbird is a quantum assembly language for continuous-variable quantum
computation, that can be used to program Xanadu’s quantum photonics
hardware and Strawberry Fields simulator.

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: py-pomegranate
dependent_to.description: Fast, flexible and easy to use probabilistic modelling in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-robocrys
dependent_to.description:
Robocrystallographer is a tool to generate text descriptions of crystal
structures. Similar to how a real-life crystallographer would analyse a
structure, robocrystallographer looks at the symmetry, local
environment, and extended connectivity when generating a description.
The package includes utilities for identifying molecule names, component
orientations, heterostructure information, and more.

dependent_to.name: py-dvc
dependent_to.description: Git for data scientists - manage your code and data together.

dependent_to.name: py-dace
dependent_to.description:
DaCe is a fast parallel programming framework that takes code in
Python/NumPy and other programming languages, and maps it to high-
performance CPU, GPU, and FPGA programs, which can be optimized
programmatically or interactively.
